pageContext.claim: “Susan Rice, who was a disaster to President Obama as National Security Advisor, is now telling us her opinion on what to do in Syria. Remember RED LINE IN THE SAND? That was Obama. Millions killed! No thanks Susan, you were a disaster.”
pageContext.analysis: Estimates suggest the total death toll is Syria is well below 1 million. The United Nations estimated in 2016 that 400,000 people have died since the beginning of the Syrian civil war in 2011. The Syrian Observatory for Human Rights estimated the death toll “to be as high as 511,000” as of March 2018.
